top_categories.workout_context: 192 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Crystal Bear's Northern Wisconsin forest service roads, Upper Peninsula forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 192 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Crystal Bear's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 192 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
192 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Crystal Bear's northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At Crystal Bear, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,000ft of climbing on northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and does to your power file on race day.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Crystal Bear. Train it until it feels boring.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Crystal Bear, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.

race_overlay.heat: May in Laona, WI to Crystal Falls, MI can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Crystal Bear. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 192 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 192 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Crystal Bear requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge to build confidence. Expect: northern wisconsin forest service roads, upper peninsula michigan gravel, sandy northwoods sections.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 192 miles of northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge in Laona, WI to Crystal Falls, MI.
